HDG.W.content: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings
HDG.W.linkedContent: what is more truly worthy [of poet’s thought, of thought] than word’s being veiling itself, the fading word for the word > oldest word for rule of word: logos—the same word, word for Saying, is word for Being, the presencing of beings

HDG.BT.content: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]
HDG.BT.linkedContent: in investigations where thing is deeply veiled, don’t overestimate results: constantly face possibility of disclosing an even more primordial/universal horizon from which to draw answer to question: “What is Being?” [Seinsfrage] > must reawaken question of Being before achieving positive results, arrive at a field where we can come to terms w/ it in a way that can be controlled [totally other—then teleological control?]

HDG.QB.content: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence
HDG.QB.linkedContent: nothing, which as absence interrupts (Abbruch) (“nullifies [nichtet]”) presence, w/out ever annihilating it > insofar as nothing “nullifies,” it confirms itself as a distinctive presence, veiling itself as such presence

HDG.FS.content: computer language makes visible end of language/tradition: surge of information veils disappearance [oblivion of oblivion] of what has been > prospective planning (Vorausplanung): obstruction (Absperren) of future
HDG.FS.linkedContent: computer language makes visible end of language/tradition: surge of information veils disappearance [oblivion of oblivion] of what has been > prospective planning (Vorausplanung): obstruction (Absperren) of future

HDG.FS.content: reality of America veiled from view of those interested: collusion btwn industry/military > decision does not belong to humans, w/out this insight (man not a being that makes himself [contra Sartrean existentialism?]), sd remain w/in political opposition of civil/industrial society > society (Gesellschaft): a mirror/extension of subjectivity
HDG.FS.linkedContent: reality of America veiled from view of those interested: collusion btwn industry/military > decision does not belong to humans, w/out this insight (man not a being that makes himself [contra Sartrean existentialism?]), sd remain w/in political opposition of civil/industrial society > society (Gesellschaft): a mirror/extension of subjectivity

HDG.FS.content: tautology only possibility for thinking what dialectic can only veil: [“exclusive approach presenting access to Being” (?)]
HDG.FS.linkedContent: tautology only possibility for thinking what dialectic can only veil: [“exclusive approach presenting access to Being” (?)]

HDG.DL.content: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message
HDG.DL.linkedContent: two-fold has already offered itself (sich angeboten) to man, though its nature remains veiled > man, insofern er Mensch ist, listens (hört) to this message > man is used for hearing it > man stands in a relation > relation is called hermeneutical: brings tidings (Kunde) of message

HDG.DL.content: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Iki: breath of stillness of luminous delight (Entzückens) > delight: what ensnares (Entziehen), carries away (Hinzücken)—into stillness > delight is the same kind as the hint that beckons on, to and fro (des Fort- und Hin- und Her-winkens) > hint is message of the veiling that opens up (lichtenden Verhüllens) > so all presence (Anwesen) has its source in grace (Anmut): pure delight of the calling stillness (rufenden Stille)

HDG.DL.content: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: Heidegger remains sparing in words that would lead to a discussion (erörtern) of Sage, would call for a journey (Wanderung) into the Ortschaft of the essence of Sage > what prompts his reserve (Züruckhaltung), insight into the untouchable (Unantastbare), veiled from us by the Geheimnis of Sage [arrive at site of Sage or never arrive?]

HDG.DL.content: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]
HDG.DL.linkedContent: are we not attempting the impossible (Unmögliche)? Allerdings — solange dem Menschen nicht jener Botengang rein gewährt ist , den die Botschaft braucht, die dem Menschen die Entbergung der Zwiefalt zuspricht [basically he says: so long as we have not been given the pure gift of messaging to course through the usage of message that grants us the unconcealment of the two-fold] > veiled relation (Verhältnis) btwn message & messenger’s course plays (spielt) everywhere [play of the trace]

HDG.LP.content: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht
HDG.LP.linkedContent: night: sheltering veiling of sun’s course > [paths] walk, ienai, ier, the year [Derrida’s anniversary ring] > Das Geistliche der Jahre: der geistlich dämmernden Bläue der Nacht

HDG.LP.content: flaming pain tears away, its rending (Fortriss) consigns [marks?] (einzeichnet) wandering soul to conjunction (Fuge) of storm [heaven]/hunt [God] > would seem pain’s rending would overwhelm (überwältigen), rather than letting soul prevail (walten) in veiling radiance > but! [here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose
HDG.LP.linkedContent: flaming pain tears away, its rending (Fortriss) consigns [marks?] (einzeichnet) wandering soul to conjunction (Fuge) of storm [heaven]/hunt [God] > would seem pain’s rending would overwhelm (überwältigen), rather than letting soul prevail (walten) in veiling radiance > but! [here is Heidegger’s refusal of differance], the beholding vision (Anschauen) can rejoin (fügt zurück) the flaming sweep (flammenden Fortriss) to the fitting submission (Fügsame) of seeing acceptance (schaunden Hinnehmens) [moral image of thought], der Rückriss im Schmerz, pain achieves its mildness, its power (Walten) to convey/disclose

HDG.WL.content: Aufriss of language will remain veiled if we don’t properly attend (eigens beachten) to spoken/unspoken [so we can arrive beyond the veil?]
HDG.WL.linkedContent: Aufriss of language will remain veiled if we don’t properly attend (eigens beachten) to spoken/unspoken [so we can arrive beyond the veil?]
